VISCOUNT VP.YNB, VP.YNC, VP.YND, VP.YNI
windows:
DOOR
EMERGENCY EXITS
Exit is normally via the main doors which may be opened by turning the
handle as indicated on the door; it is essential the trigger be firmly
depressed before attempting to turn the handle. Each window designed
as an emergency exit is clearly marked and can be opened by lifting the
cover above it, pulling the red handle that is now exposed as far as it
will move, grasping the large transparent handle on the window and
pulling the window inwards. Leave the aircraft by stepping through the
window on to the wing, one foot first followed by head and shoulders, and
move down the wing towards the rear, sliding off the end. If the window
used is not over the wing, exercise caution as the drop to the ground
may be considerable. Do not attempt to take anything with you.
ESCAPE
SLIDE
As the door is 8 feet above the ground, a canvas escape slide is provided
to assist in rapid evacuation. It is stowed near the passanger entrance
door and would normally be rigged and supervised by the Hostess. It is
attached by four hooks to four rings around the door frame, two on the
floor and one on each side half way up. The lower end is thrown out of
the door and firmly held by the two pilots or able-bodied passengers
standing outside.
ESCAPE ROPES
An escape rope is provided near each door for use in leaving the aircraft
in an emergency.
EMERGENCY LANDING
In the possible event of an emergency, the Captain will announce
"Prepare for an emergency landing".
In these circumstances please
keep calm and follow instructions from the crew.
Your crew has
undertaken regular specialised instruction and is well qualified to
deal with any emergency. The following general precautions should
be taken:-
1.
Loosen neckwear, remove glasses, dentures and high heeled
shoes.
Fasten your seat belt tightly and stop smoking.
Note the position of the emergency exists.
Just prior to the landing grab your ankles and remain in this
position until the aircraft has come to rest.
5.
Leave the aircraft as directed by the Hostess and when
outside stand well clear due to the risk of fire.
City Printers
DOOR
DOOR

AIR RHODESIA
please read
carefully
for your safety
Flying with an airline is safe but it is advisable that you should know what to do
in an emergency. Safety measures are legally required in Air Travel as in other
forms of transport. Your safety in our care is our first concern.
smoking: Smoking is allowed except during ground manoeuvres, take - off.
landing and sometimes in flight. An illuminated sign in your cabin will indicate
when not to smoke.
Cigarettes only are permittec
seat belts: The seat belt must always be fastened during take-off and landing
and occasionally when turbulent air conditions are encountered. An Illuminated
sign will tell vou when seat belts must be tastened; at other times it is wise C
keep them fastened unless it is inconvenient.
hand baggage: Apart from clothing and similar light articles, baggage must
not be olaced on the racks as this may cause inur in turbulence
portable electronic equipment: Operation of portable radios or similar
equipment is not allowed as this may interfere
systems on the
